messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New here
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Leroy, welsome to the list, great to have you here. What s best depends totally on what they are, who made them, state of polish is not as important as the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Leroy, welsome to the list, great to have you here.

What's best depends totally on what they are, who made them, state of
polish is not as important as the state of the sword. If the 1930's
sword has NBTHK Hozon, then it will be a good smith I assume, there were
many great smiths in the mid 1800's and the new swords are good also.

what have you been reading ?.

Rich Turner


Richard Turner
Nihontô Message Board
<http://members5.boardhost.com/Nihon-To/>
- /for the discussion and sharing of all things Nihontô/





leroymchavez wrote:

>
> Hello everybody. I'm a newbiy here so I thought I might introduce

> I have been doing my best to read as much as I can about Nihonto. I
> think I am ready to purchase on, and now I would like some opinions.
>
> I was wondering what you would choose. I found 3 swords that I like
> and are about in my price range; One was made in 1977, one in the
> 1930's (papered-NBTHK) and another in the 1860's (papered-NBTHK).
>
> Of those with more experience, which would you choose? The one from
> the 1860's does have some light rust, the others are in full polish.
> The dealers are reputable.
>
> Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks in advance.
>
> Leroy

messages.subject: New here
messages.msgSnippet: Hello everybody. I m a newbiy here so I thought I might introduce myself a little. My name is Leroy and I live in Northern California. I have been doing my
messages.messageBody:
Hello everybody. I'm a newbiy here so I thought I might introduce
myself a little. My name is Leroy and I live in Northern California.
I have been doing my best to read as much as I can about Nihonto. I
think I am ready to purchase on, and now I would like some opinions.

I was wondering what you would choose. I found 3 swords that I like
and are about in my price range; One was made in 1977, one in the
1930's (papered-NBTHK) and another in the 1860's (papered-NBTHK).

Of those with more experience, which would you choose? The one from
the 1860's does have some light rust, the others are in full polish.
The dealers are reputable.

Any help would be much appreciated. Thanks in advance.

Leroy
